node.postTitle: The 3 Best Dog Travel Crates ( 2021 Update )

postDescription.postDescription: Whether you opt to use a dog car crate or some other kind of dog car restraint, your dog needs to be secure while you’re driving or traveling.

categoryDescription.categoryDescription: All you need to know about dog gear (recommendations and reviews) to keep your G.A.S. (Gear Aquisition Syndrome) under control.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
In the event of an accident, your dog will become an instant projectile, flying through the windshield and injuring you, other passengers, and themselves.

Having an unrestrained dog in your car often results in distracted driving. Using a restraint will keep both you and your dog safer.

Dog Crate Sizes

Extra Small

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 22in (56cm). Extra small dogs from the Toy Dogs Group can fit well in this crate size: Chihuahua, Yorkshire Terrier, Affenpinscher, Biewer Terrier, etc.

Small

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 24in (60cm). Small dogs mainly from the Toy Dogs Group can fit well in this crate size: Maltese, Bichon Frise, Miniature Pinscher, Pugs, etc.

Medium

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 30in (75cm). Medium-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Bulldogs, Dachshund, etc.

Intermediate

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 36in (91cm). Intermediate-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Bull Terriers, Beagles, etc.

Large

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 42in (105cm). Large-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Australian Shepherds, Border Collies, Dalmatians, Retrievers, etc.

Extra Large

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 48in (120cm). Extra large-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: German Shepherds, Belgian Malinois, Huskies, Akitas, etc.

Always give more space for your dog than the measurements given by the breed information.

Dog Travel Crate Types

Foldable Fabric Crates

These crates are most appropriate for very small breeds and small puppies, especially if you’re going to be taking your pet as a carry-on on an airplane or they will be traveling with you when you run errands. If you have a heavy chewer, be sure to inspect your fabric crate each time you use it to make sure that there are no weak spots or tears where your dog could escape.

Plastic Dog Crates aka Plastic Flight Kennel

As the name says, this panel is mainly made of plastic with a wired door. If you are planning an air travel, make sure that the crate you choose is approved for flight use.

Heavy-Duty Dog Crates

Made out of aluminum, these crates are sturdier and provide better protection for your dog. If you have a heavy chewer than a heavy-duty crate is the answer.

Foldable Fabric Crates

  • High-quality, foldable transport box for dogs.
  • It is light, flexible and set up in seconds.
  • This box is the alternative to heavy cages or rigid plastic boxes. The fast set-up and the possibility of folding it flat when not in use make this kennel very versitile.
  • In addition to the side entry, it has a top opening, carry bag and blackout blinds on all sides (except on top).

Check On Amazon

Plastic Dog Crates aka Plastic Flight Kennel

  • Approved by all European aviation companies
  • Available in different sizes
  • High quality plastic and wiring
  • Ventilation slots ensure optimal air circulation
  • Metal mesh door with a practical locking system for quick opening and secure locking
  • Rigid construction made of heavy plastics, the door lock is made of metal and the side frame made of a particularly durable surface
  • Comes with two front wheels and two rear wheels that turns the transport box into a mobile home for your animal (only for sizes: L, XL, XXL and XXXL)

Check On Amazon

Heavy-Duty Dog Crates

  • This dog transport box is easy to assemble and offers the ideal protection for your four-legged friend.
  • Due to its trapezoidal construction it allows you to easily place the box in your car and it is easy to carry around as well.
  • Due to the wide openings, your dog will receive plenty of fresh air.
  • This dog box is made of aluminium and MDF offering a good protections for your dog.

Check On Amazon

Knowledge Makes You and Your Dog Happy! Furry Canine Team

node.postTitle: The 3 Best Dog Collars and Harnesses ( 2021 Update )

postDescription.postDescription: The 4 Best Dog Collars and Harnesses In 2020 - The Most Important Collar and Harness Features, Types, and What To Buy Guide.

categoryDescription.categoryDescription: All you need to know about dog gear (recommendations and reviews) to keep your G.A.S. (Gear Aquisition Syndrome) under control.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Best Dog Collars and Harnesses 2020 - Important Collar and Harness Features

Material

Depending on the type of collar some are made of cotton, leather, some sort of steel or nylon.

While a chain collar is nice during the summer and when the dog enters the water, they are not as suited for a daily basis use.

A leather collar will last you a very long time, making it a good investment.

Harnesses, on the other hand, are made out of a combination of materials. Although you can also find good harnesses made of leather, it will cost you more money. Harnesses, when chosen wisely, will last you very long as well, so it might be worth the investment.

Depending on your dog's fur you can choose either a more protective one (with more material) or a more simple one (material is present mainly on the straps).

Width

Width is for me one of the main criteria according to which I chose the daily collar for my dog. The width I prefer is minumum 1in (2,5cm).

For the harness, I chose also a roundabout 1in (2,5cm) width for the straps.

Comfort

Make sure that the flat collar of your choice has padding all around the inside of the collar, as well as a protective flap for the buckle. I like the collars to have a separate ring for the dog tags as well.

A comfortable harness will not press on your dog's ness when he is sniffing, and will not create friction between his front legs and strap when walking or running. This means that it is more preferable to have a Y-shaped harness in the front and a good clearance for the dog's front legs.

Watch out with overheating in summer if you use a harness.

How tight should a dog collar or harness be?

After you put the collar on your dog’s neck slip two fingers between the dog’s neck and collar to ensure that it is not too tight. The same measurements I take for the harness as well.

A poorly-fitting collar can affect your dog’s eating, drinking and even breathing, which will obviously lead to catastrophic outcomes. A collar that’s too stiff (like the ones one made from untreated leather) can also cause irritation to the dog’s neck.

Best Dog Collars and Harnesses 2020 - Dog Collar and Harness Types - What Should You Buy?

Choke Collars

In essence, these collars are chains that contract and expand, exerting pressure on your dog’s neck.

I do not recommend using this type of collar at all.

E-Collars

E-collars (electronic collars) deliver a mild to moderate pulse to a dog. Again, I do not recommend using this type of collar at all.

Martingale Collars

A martingale collar is made of two loops: one that fits around the dog’s neck and another (the control loop) that attaches to a leash. Because of this construction, it functions much like a choke collar but doesn’t put the same kind of pressure on the trachea.

Also I do not recommend using this type of collar at all.

Prong Collars

Prong or pinch collars are similar in design to choke collars, except instead of the links being curved and smooth, an open piece of metal extends beyond the link and pinches the dog’s neck.

I do not recommend using this type of collar at all.

Flat Collars

A flat collar is similar to a human belt. It serves well as a means to maintain positive control of your pet.

Flat collars are the most common collars worldwide. Almost every dog will wear a flat collar at some point in his life, whether during his puppy years or all the time. They come in an array of options, so it is important to choose the right one for your dog’s size and make it fit correctly.

Most of the time you will use one collar that you and your dog will accept the best. Take your time in choosing it and instead of investing in 2-3 collars, make a bigger investment in 1 good one.

Check On Amazon

  • High quality: the high quality, genuine cowhide leather is carefully chosen and the collar is individually sewn by hand.
  • Robust and resistant: the combination of brown outer and black inner leather makes the collar not only stylish but also sturdy and durable.
  • Comfortable to wear: the soft lining leather inner makes the collar extremely comfortable to wear.
  • Well thought out design: the silver buckle and ring are close together, so that no metal parts press against the neck when you pull on the lead.
  • Suitable for all dogs: the three sizes are suitable for all small, medium or large dogs and puppies.

Front-Clip Harness

A front-clip harness allows you to hook the leash in front of the sternum (chest bone) of the dog.

The purpose of a front clip harness is to provide you with extra control over your dog. When your dog pulls towards something, the front leash attachment point causes them to turn around towards you the moment you pull on the leash.

Check On Amazon

  • 2 x metal clips: one top and one on the chest.
  • It provides a good fit and is highly adjustable.
  • It comes with a top handle.
  • The harness is for heavy-duty and comes padded on the inside.
  • You can stick patches on the sides.

Back-Clip Harness

A back-clip harness allows you to hook the leash at the back of the harness right on top of the mid-back or between the shoulder blades of your dog. The harnesses are especially useful for small dogs with delicate throats easily damaged by collars.

I have 3 circumstances when I use the above-pictured harness on my dog:

  • When I take my dog for hikes and I don’t know the terrain. It is easier to pull out a dog from a ditch by the harness than by the collar or skin.
  • When I take my dog alongside my bicycle. I don’t want to accidentally yank his neck with the bike.
  • When I have my dog in the car and I use the seatbelt option. Again I don’t want him to be yanked by his neck in case of a strong brake.

When back-clip harnesses are used with an untrained dog who likes to pull, they create a sled-pulling action, with the owner dragged along in place of the sled. And believe me, dogs are strong :-).

Check On Amazon

  • The high-quality nylon material makes it breathable, and neat stitching makes it strong and durable when your dog pulling.
  • The straps are well padded in all the areas for your dog's comfort.
  • You can adjust the straps until it fits your dog comfortably, keep in mind to check the size chart first.
  • Does't come in contact with your dog's throat or front legs, making it higly confortable for your dog in every situation.

For safety reasons, I will not describe nor advertise the use of the choke, electronic, martingale or prong collars. In my opinion, if you think you need to use one of the above, you should consult a professional that can show you how to work with those collars… if really necessary.

I have a reactive dog as well and I only use a flat collar for our normal walks and I can still correct my dog with my voice to not react. It is because we developed a bond and relationship that allows me to do that.

I suffered of a lot of G.A.S. until I found the right equipment. After that I only have two flat collars and two back clip harnesses. We get dirty a lot :-).

I mainly walk my dog leash/collar free (there were dogs are allowed to run free).

Knowledge Makes You and Your Dog Happy! Furry Canines Team

postDescription.postDescription: A leash (also called a lead, lead line) is your main mean to control your dog by attaching it to a collar or harness while others go directly around the dog's neck.

categoryDescription.categoryDescription: All you need to know about dog gear (recommendations and reviews) to keep your G.A.S. (Gear Aquisition Syndrome) under control.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Best Dog Leashes In 2020 - Important Leash Features

Here is what to consider when selecting a leash for your dog:

Length

The most common leash length is 6 ft (1,8m). This is a happy medium length that gives your dog some space to roam but isn’t so long that it’s hard to keep your dog close. If you usually walk your dog on busy city streets, a shorter 4 ft (1m) option is preferable, as it’s easier to keep your dog close. Long 10 or 15 ft (3m or 5m) leashed are best suited to walking in parks or on hiking trails.

Width

The wider the leash, the stronger it is, so make sure you choose a leash wide enough for the size of your dog. A half-inch (1cm) leash might be fine for walking small dogs but look for an option of at least an inch (2,5cm) wide from medium or large dogs.

Comfort

Hold it, try it and you will feel what is right for you. For me, an inch (2,5cm) wide leash feels better than the slip lead I own simply because of the material it is made of. I like sturdy materials, that don’t get slippery and cut into my hand if they get wet.

Best Dog Leashes In 2020 - Types of Dog Leashes

Standard Leashes

Standard leashes have a loop handle at one end and a metal clip at the other end to attach to your dog's collar. These leashes are intended to use on a daily basis and during training.

Typically available in lengths from 4 to 8 ft (approx. 1 - 2,5m). I personally use a standard 8ft (2,5m) leash only when I go out for potty purposes with my dog. I use a 4ft (1m) leash for our city walks.

Standard leashes are most commonly flat. Flat leashes come in various widths, usually getting wider and thicker for larger and stronger dogs.

Tow Leashes

Important and effective when you want to teach your dog to walk off-leash. Tow leashes are similar to standard leashes just much longer 16 to 32 ft (5-10m), so pick whatever you feel comfortable with. Some may have a loop handle some may not.

Adjustable Leashes

Adjustable leashes have one or multiple loops along the leash that allows a clasp to shorten or lengthen the leash.

You may want to use an adjustable leash to wrap it around your waist or torso. Commonly used by those owners that jog with their dogs.

Slip Leads for Dogs

Slip leads are two-in-one collar and leash. The leash loops onto itself and goes over the dog’s head.

If your dog pulls on the leash, the collar part will tighten. This can be dangerous since it can suffocate your dog if it tightens up too much, similar to choke collars. Also, be aware that your dog may be able to loosen the area around the neck and slip out. It’s important for a dog to wear a separate collar with identification when using a slip lead if this is your daily leash.

Retractable Leashes

A retractable leash is made of the plastic handle that allows a thin length of cord to wraps around a spring-loaded device housed inside. It works similar to the measuring tapes. A button on the handle controls the amount of cord that extends.

I always will tell you to throw the Flexi line in the bin and get a standard good leash and it will serve you well in all situations. Why would you have a leash at which your dog can pull? So not only he is leading you but your dog also learns leash = pulling and be the leader. This might be worse leash you could own honestly. Sorry if someone’s feelings are hurt, but there is no grey zone with dogs.

The 4 Best Dog Leashes In 2020 - What Should You Buy?

Standard Leash - The Julius K9 Super Grip

  • Made from strong and durable but comfortable to hold material.
  • Easy to hold and it will not become slippery when wet.
  • Rubber threads are woven into the material to ensure an optimal.
  • Available in a range of lengths, with or without handle, and in various colors.

  • This leash features a soft padded handle and makes it feel good in the hand.
  • The 20ft (6m) leash is used for helping you train the recall of your dog without the dog running off.

node.postTitle: The 3 Strongest Dog Crates For Indoors - 2021 Update

postDescription.postDescription: When it comes to selecting your puppy’s **new crate** you need to take into consideration the full size of your dog when he will be an adult.

categoryDescription.categoryDescription: All you need to know about dog gear (recommendations and reviews) to keep your G.A.S. (Gear Aquisition Syndrome) under control.

childMarkdownRemark.html:
Whether you have a puppy or an adult dog, you should choose a crate that is large enough for him to stand up comfortably, turn around inside the crate, and lay down comfortably as a full-sized adult.

Also consider the fact that you might need or want to crate the dog while you are not at home, and it is imperative for your dog to have clean water during those hours. This is another influencing detail when choosing the size of the crate.

One very good accessory for a crate is the crate cover. Crate covers have the benefit of providing a more den-like feeling, since the crate is less exposed on three sides and allows your dog to actually enjoy being in his own cozy, safe little hideaway and will often choose to go there for naps, to chew on his favorite toy, or to get away from the noise/fuss of visitors, etc.

The crate must have a fixed spot in your house. This spot must not be an isolated spot from the rest of the house, because this will give the dog the message that crating is negative since he will be isolated far away from the loved ones. At the same time, the spot should not be in a busy, noisy kitchen either. If it is too noisy the dog can’t find peace and quiet for his nappies and recharge.

Dog Crate Sizes

Extra Small

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 22in (56cm). Extra small dogs from the Toy Dogs Group can fit well in this crate size: Chihuahua, Yorkshire Terrier, Affenpinscher, Biewer Terrier, etc.

Small

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 24in (60cm). Small dogs mainly from the Toy Dogs Group can fit well in this crate size: Maltese, Bichon Frise, Miniature Pinscher, Pugs, etc.

Medium

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 30in (75cm). Medium-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Bulldogs, Dachshund, etc.

Intermediate

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 36in (91cm). Intermediate-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Bull Terriers, Beagles, etc.

Large

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 42in (105cm). Large-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: Australian Shepherds, Border Collies, Dalmatians, Retrievers, etc.

Extra Large

This crate size is usable for dogs that will grow as high as about 48in (120cm). Extra large-sized dogs from the can fit well in this crate size: German Shepherds, Belgian Malinois, Huskies, Akitas, etc.

Always give more space for your dog than the measurements given by the breed information.

Home Dog Crate Types

Basic Wire Crate

Most of the times home crates are a basic wire dog crate or a crate that looks like furniture and it will not be used for traveling.

A basic wire crate is usually collapsible and can easily be transported if you need to take your crate with you. Wire crates are bulky and not adapted to a car’s design, so most probably will not fit in a regular, medium-sized car.

Check On Amazon

  • Dog crate with double-door design for convenient front and side entry.
  • Two slide-bolt door latches for increased safety and security.
  • Folds flat for easy storage/portability with sturdy metal construction.
  • Designed with mini dividers (.81 cm between each bar) on the bottom perimeter to prevent paws from slipping through.
  • Optional divider panel and removable composite plastic pan included.
  • Available in various sizes.

Soft-Sided Dog Crate

This type of dog kennel isn’t for every dog. They are usually made of canvas or nylon and are therefore more destructible than wire or plastic crates. They’re also more difficult to clean, can be easy for curious pups to escape from, or destructive animals to chew through.

But there are also several pros for soft-sided crates: they’re lightweight, great for travel, and can be stored easily.

Check On Amazon

  • High-quality, foldable transport box for dogs.
  • It is light, flexible and set up in seconds.
  • This box is the alternative to heavy cages or rigid plastic boxes.
  • The fast set-up and the possibility of folding it flat when not in use make this kennel very versitile.
  • In addition to the side entry, it has a top opening, carry bag and blackout blinds on all sides (except on top).

Furniture Dog Crates

Also known as fashion crates, the wood or rattan finish of these crates certainly looks the best of all these options around the house, and some can even double as a side table, being somewhat functional too.

The downside is that these are not suitable for destructive dogs.

Check On Amazon

  • Versatile: let your dog feel the safety. Either cosy at home or on the go when you travel
  • Collapsible: The dog kennel is easy to fold and therefore very space-saving and portable.
  • Natural: the hut is made of fir wood and has a natural paint to not endanger your dog. The cabin is lifted and thus prevents the accumulation of moisture
  • Easy to clean: the roof is hinged for quick access. Extendable base for easy cleaning
  • Dimensions: L84.5 x W51.4 x H61 cm, folding dimensions: L84.5 x W59 x H13.5 cm.

Conclusion

Personally we are super lucky with our dog. If we go to work he sleeps most of the time on the sofa or bed. Yes, we allow that. So we only have a basic wire box folded up and almost never in use.

Check out and test what works for you and your dog, because no one can honestly say they know what you and your dog need.

Knowledge Makes You and Your Dog Happy! Furry Canines Team
